meanings.definition: Tending to find fault or raise petty objections.
meanings.sent1: She always had a captious attitude towards her classmates' work.
meanings.sent2: The captious customer complained about every little detail of the meal.
meanings.sent3: The captious cat refused to eat the food unless it was served in a specific bowl.
meanings.sent4: His captious nature made it difficult for others to feel appreciated.
meanings.sent5: The captious teacher never seemed satisfied with any answer given by the students.

meanings.sent1: The captious question was designed to trip up the interviewee.
meanings.sent2: He devised a captious puzzle that left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent3: The captious riddle was so tricky that no one could solve it.
meanings.sent4: Her captious remarks were meant to sow discord among the group.
meanings.sent5: The captious maze was a challenge even for the most experienced adventurers.
